title: Why Is SiteCore CMS Highly Preferred By Developers Around The World (Anthony Weiner)
text: By Anthony Weiner Oct 10, 2015 A content management system or a CMS is a web framework that allows you to create and manage the content on your website easily and efficiently. While you can choose to build a website without a CMS, using one can ensure that your website's content is doing exactly what it is supposed to do - that is, strengthening your online brand image. A CMS can help with easy workflow management by making the developing process more flexible and separating the design process from content creation. CMS can improve the search ranking of a website by making it mobile ready. It can increase the organic traffic flow to the website by improving user experience. In the long run, it can lead to better conversion rates and therefore, improved ROI. You do not need to be a technical genius to use a CMS for your website. In fact, one of the main benefits of a CMS lies in the fact that it does not force you to get bogged down by unnecessary technical details. However, not all CMSes work equally well. Some are excellent, some are good, some others are just passable. One CMSes that works exceptionally well and is equally liked by developers, designers and business owners around the world is the SiteCore CMS.Take a quick look at the main reasons behind this widespread popularity of SiteCore:Easy yet powerful framework - SiteCore has a bottom-up strategy that creates reusable site components in a single repository. These components can be selected, assembled and syndicated across many sites. Thus, SiteCore's framework allows sophisticated web development.Easy and effective features - SiteCore has a world-class user interface. It has a Microsoft office 2007-style 'ribbon interface that gives users easy access and complete control over the content creation, editing, publishing and updating processes. As stated earlier, there is no need to be technical genius. Smart technology - Sitecore is built on Microsoft .NET 2.0 technologies. This means a site built with SiteCore will run in any browser or browser-based device. SiteCore is also compliant with Worldwide Consortiums open Internet standards like SOAP (Web services), XML, etc. Flexibility - SiteCore allows easy integration with external systems for content delivery with the help of full data integration and abstraction layer (SiteCore Data Providers). The CMSes workflow engine has easy versioning, controlled approvals, incremental publishing, notifications and archiving options. Mobile-ready - SiteCore automatically scales your content to fit the screen of mobile devices. Thus, by mobilizing Sitecore, you can connect with your target audience across multiple devices. Search engine optimization - SiteCore has an in-built SEO module that enables you to see how your site will fare on a search engine and which parts of the site need adaptive optimization. The CMS also natively delivers Google-friendly URLs, which improve the ranking of the site.Scalability - SiteCore is powerful enough to drive the largest and elaborate website. Excellent user experience is guaranteed as SiteCore uses a combination of high availability options, intelligent caching controls as well as has the power of ASP. NET 2.0. In case, you have not yet decided on a CMS for your website, selecting SiteCore can be a solid decision. The aforementioned factors prove that SiteCore is one of the most comprehensive CMSes available today. In order to make your website the best it can be, in terms of content, contact experienced SiteCore developers. Ask how this innovative CMS can help you strengthen your business' online brand image and improve your ROI. About the Author John Murphy has been working in the digital space for quite a while now. He studies the current market trends and offers advice to many organizations to plan, create and update websites that comply with these trends. He is an extensive blogger and has written several articles related to SiteCore CMS and recommends it strongly. Rating:
